event.title: made land grants in this area in 1765

data.event: Colonial Governor Benning Wentworth first made land grants in this area in 1765, but the location was so deep in unexplored territory that few settlers took up their claims.
Brother to William Whipple, a signer of the Declaration of Independence, Colonel Whipple renamed the town "Jefferson" four years prior to Thomas Jefferson's election as president.

event.title: granted the town a new charter as "Jefferson" in 1796

data.event: The state legislature granted the town a new charter as "Jefferson" in 1796.
